content: The human brain is a mysterious and beautiful thing because mine can enjoy games like Stalker and Hell Let Loose. And yet, it also absolutely loves The Sims 4. That carbon monoxide alarm went off. It was making my head dizzy. I used to play a lot of Sims 4 on this channel. It was a long time ago, long before YouTube started shoveling my content into people's faces. And you can tell because the thumbnails I made for those videos were absolutely unhinged. But I still love The Sims. I get the urge to reinstall Sims 4 again all the time. But EA is determined to turn The Sims 4 into Sims Infinite. Sims 4 came out in 2014. And instead of making a new Sims game at any point in the last decade, they just keep making sleek bathroom, comfy gamer, redefined living room. Until recently, I was told that The Sims 5 just came out and that it was completely photorealistic, completely Korean, and it also apparently is the first game I've ever seen that uses AI. Oh my god. I don't know how I feel about that to be honest, like on a spiritual level, but I knew I wanted to find out. And I think there might be a glitch in the version I downloaded because the game kept calling itself Enzoy instead of Sims 5 and the characters were called Zo instead of Sims. But I decided to go along with it. Every moment is a branding moment. And so began the life of the disturbingly realistic John Zoy. This is terrifying. He's like a blowfish. And John Zoy's life was extremely depressing. It's like a trait. It is just like the Sims. Authoritarian. honest and bold. All right, so hang on. If I am authoritarian and then I go back to facial hair. John Zoy was a single, unemployed, uneducated man in parachute pants. He had no family, not a single friend in this world. And I had only a few thousand to build him an entire house on beachfront property in Los Angeles. Okay. Okay. This looks very sad. So, I did my best, but I basically built him a cave. And once I was done building, I discovered that I could control John. I am him. I'm walking around. Whoa. Can I get in his brain? This was something I always thought would be awesome in the Sims. And it was awesome to be able to run around in the house that I built finally after all these years playing the Sims. I'm Italian. Can I sprint? I can sprint. What the heck? AI motion make AI emote emote generation method video or image. What? Make an emote based upon an upload video file. I Okay, you know what I'll do? I'll make it based off of an image and I'll do the Halo Infinite box art. What is he is he going to do the pose that Master Chief is doing on the box art? But I quickly realized that I don't know what I'm supposed to do in this game. The Sims kind of spells it out for you and puts you on a path right away, but I forgot to change back the authoritarian trait after that bit I did earlier. So John's only aspiration in life is to be an [ __ ] Goals: take out anger on a vending machine. How do I get a job then? How do I get a job? This place sucks. So I did what anyone would do in this situation. I accosted random women on the street. I beat up parking meters. what's wrong with you? And I was going to do this until someone either gave me a job or married me into a wealthy family. But that was hard to do when all the conversation topics I could choose from when talking to strangers on the street were weirdly specific. Say life's best teacher is death. like discussing the benefits of the carnivore diet or asking someone if they have a thing for mint chocolate or my personal favorite, asking a random woman on the street her opinion on the stock prospects of the K-pop and entertainment industries. So instead, I decided to mess around with the AI emotes some more because that Master Chief emote was really fantastic. the Master Chief. I'm going to try putting in the Gritty first, but I also have the opening sequence to Saving Private Ryan, and I'm really interested to see what that looks like. The Gritty is really uncanny and weird, but it is undeniably the gritty. So, I want you to take a moment to imagine what this game did with the opening sequence in Saving Private Ryan. That nearly made me piss myself laughing. But I can't deny that it feels so dystopian to be using AI in a game like this. This is the first time I've ever seen it in a game I'm playing before. And it's fine here, but I know where this is headed. We all know where this is headed. Oh my god, this is incredible. I just got to buy a car. But speaking of losing jobs, John did eventually find a job. Austin Black from Black family quit their job. Oh wow. I'm gonna find Austin Black and kill him. Apply. Congratulations on joining Posy Surf Shop. He became the cashier at a surf shop. And I like working at the surf shop. Talking myself in the mirror. This is what I'm doing at work. The tasks are satisfying. And they have great music in there. This music is great. Way better than my first job, which was also a cashier, but at an Arby's across from a hospital that was just all juice, sauce, and sadness all day long with no good music. And I know that has nothing to do with this video, but it's my channel. I can trauma dump if I want to. But I made no money after an entire in-game day of just doing random tasks in that surf shop. And so I wanted to see if making money would even be worth it in this game because again, I don't even know what's possible. He's threatening a random woman in the middle of the night. Hey dude, do I need to step in here? And swapping to a family who had money was eye opening. Oh, but they have $29,000. Hang on. How do you have $29,000 and you're unemployed? Can I play as you? Oh, wow. Oh, this is weird. Wow. This life is so much less depressing. We're going to buy a car. We're going to buy We can buy a Hyundai. The product placement of this game is out of control. Oh, there's the car. There's his car. All right. Drive. That's Oh, no. You can drive cars in this game. This game is running circles around the sim. Sorry for not being good enough. Wait, what? I want to make you proud, but it wasn't easy. Is this my son? It's honestly a bit scary to see how many things this game can do. It's trying to be a very realistic Second Life simulator. And once they get the AI able to talk back to your typed sentences, the Pandora's box will be fully open in development. But I will say because of that, the one thing this game does not have is the innocent goofiness of the Sims. Tesla Mangro then Torby Santa. If I set someone on fire in this game, I'd probably get PTSD. So, there's still room in my heart for The Sims 5, but until that comes out in 2036, I'm going to be here. He's clapping. at what? He's clapping at nothing. It's actually insane. Trying to earn enough money to get Jon into therapy. And speaking of therapy, thank you for wasting your precious time and mental damage on my stupid content. Zero charm, zero critical thinking. Man, I made this way too realistic. All this channel is is me yapping about whatever I did for fun last week. Same as it was in 2019. And hopefully it gave you a giggle. Oh, look. There's the food that I ordered. Yep. No, you can just leave that there. It's not food or anything. Side note, I will be selling drugs on Twitch today if you're interested. But for the YouTube version of my voice, that's all I got. That's crazy that you can drive cars in this game. Can I kill people with it? Thanks again for the privilege of your time, I've been your host, John Zoy, and should you waste your time here again in the future, then I will see you next in Zoy hell with these people. You can still read it. Pass out stratosph of smooth braining so far. I wouldn't make this information public, my guy. Super sen, I'll see you in your dreams. I I recognize that profile picture anywhere, Yago. That this is creepy. Stop it. Get some help. Goodbye. Oh man.
title: The most dystopian AI game I've ever played - InZOI
author: habie147

key_facts: EA has not released a new Sims game in the last decade.
The Sims 5 was rumored to be photorealistic and Korean-made.
The Sims 5 reportedly uses AI for character generation and emotes.
The user downloaded a version of The Sims 5 that incorrectly named the game 'Enzoy'.
John Zoy is a single, unemployed, uneducated man in parachute pants with no family or friends.
John Zoy was given $3,000 to build a house on beachfront property in Los Angeles.
John Zoy became a cashier at Posy Surf Shop after applying for a job.
The surf shop has satisfying tasks and good music.
The user could control John Zoy’s actions and thoughts directly.
The game allows driving cars and includes product placement for Hyundai.
The game features AI-generated emotes based on uploaded videos or images.
The user attempted to create an emote using Halo Infinite box art.
The game's opening sequence from Saving Private Ryan was rendered via AI.
John Zoy had a goal to take out anger on a vending machine due to his authoritarian trait.
key_opinions: The Sims 5 feels dystopian to use AI in a game like this.
The AI-generated emotes are uncanny but undeniably gritty.
The game lacks the innocent goofiness of previous Sims titles.
The realism of The Sims 5 is terrifying and emotionally overwhelming.
The user feels PTSD might result from setting someone on fire in the game.
The game’s conversation topics with strangers are weirdly specific and inappropriate.
The user believes the game is trying to be a very realistic Second Life simulator.
The user doubts the game will ever be worth playing if it becomes too realistic.
The user finds the idea of AI talking back to typed sentences dangerous.
The user thinks the game’s branding moments are excessive and intrusive.
The user feels the channel content is just them yapping about fun activities.
The user believes they made the game too realistic for comfort.
The user thinks the game’s music at the surf shop is better than Arby’s.
The user jokes about selling drugs on Twitch as a side note.
The user expresses concern about where AI in games is headed.
key_datapoints: The user had $3,000 to build a house in Los Angeles.
The family the user swapped into had $29,000.
The user played The Sims 4 long before YouTube began promoting their content.
The user downloaded a version of The Sims 5 labeled as 'Enzoy'.
The user attempted to generate an emote based on a video file.
The user tested AI emotes using the Gritty and Saving Private Ryan sequences.
The user spent one full in-game day working at the surf shop.
The user earned no money after a full in-game workday.
The user claims the game runs circles around the original Sims.
The user mentions the game is set to release in 2036 (hypothetical).
The user says the game’s AI can generate emotes from image uploads.
The user notes the game includes product placement for Hyundai.
The user describes the game’s interface as calling characters 'Zo' instead of 'Sims'.
The user states the game’s AI can respond to typed sentences.
